programme.title: NASA Explorers
programme.desc: These are our explorers. They’re the people who will get us to the Moon, collect Moon rocks, deliver them to Earth safely, and ensure that we can study them for years to come.

programme.title: 75 Years of Armstrong: Airborne Science
programme.desc: NASA Armstrong’s Flight research center is honoring 75 years of advancing technology and science through flight. For the next year there will be monthly reoccurring videos released to help tell the past 75 years of NASA Armstrong. This month’s theme is efficiency! Starting in the 1970’s new advancements were made to make flying more economical and faster. Learn about the history of airplane advancement through flight.

programme.title: The Year of Pluto
programme.desc: New Horizons is the first mission to the Kuiper Belt, a giant zone of icy bodies and mysterious small objects orbiting beyond Neptune. This region also known as the ”Third” zone of our solar system, beyond the inner rocky planets and outer gas giants. John Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory, in Maryland, designed, built and operates the Bew Horizons space craft and manages the mission for NASA’s Science Missions directorate in Washington. The Year of Pluto - NASA New Horizon is a one hour documentary that takes on the hard science and gives us the answers to how the mission came about and why it matters. New Horizons is part of the New Frontiers Program managed by NASA’s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama.

programme.title: JPL and the Space Age: The Hunt for Space
programme.desc: NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory is widely known for its trailblazing role in space exploration, and the “JPL and the Space Age” documentary series invites viewers to relive those early adventures through rare archival footage and interviews with many of JPL’s pioneering engineers and scientists.

programme.title: Other Worlds: Planets
programme.desc: The planets of our solar system are full of mysteries. Meet a few of the scientists who are using the James Webb Space Telescope to look at our solar system and beyond.

programme.title: NASA Presents: Down to Earth
programme.desc: Astronauts disclose their views on space travel, the space station, living in a gravity free environment and on the life altering effects of seeing the Earth from space for the first time.

programme.title: STEMonstrations
programme.desc: STEMonstrations are STEM demonstrations on the space station.

programme.title: Man at the Moon
programme.desc: Man at the Moon.

programme.title: Moon 101
programme.desc: NASA’s documentary series about the Moon.

programme.title: NASA’s Advanced Air Mobility Playbook
programme.desc: NASA’s vision for Advanced Air Mobility, or AAM, is to map out a safe, accessible, and affordable new air transportation system alongside industry partners, community partners and the FAA. NASA is researching what ride quality could be like for passengers traveling in eVTOL aircraft, to make sure it is a smooth and safe ride. In this episode of NASA’s Advanced Air Mobility Playbook, RVLT Project Flight Dynamics and Control Technical Lead Carlos Malpica explains why NASA is uniquely qualified for this research and why it’s important to the future of flight.
